stance_1: I eat more chicken and fish
stance_2: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that cutting back on beef and pork is accompanied by eating more chicken and fish.

stance_1: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
justification: The interviewee explicitly links cutting back on beef and pork to the discovery of high cholesterol.

stance_1: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
stance_2: My doctor recommended cutting back on red meat
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that the doctor's recommendation to cut back on red meat led to their behavior change.

stance_1: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
justification: The goal of being healthier is given as a reason for cutting back on beef and pork.

stance_1: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
stance_2: I have lost weight from eating less meat
justification: The interviewee perceives a weight loss linked to eating less meat, including beef and pork.

stance_1: I grew up eating pork dishes
stance_2: It was difficult to cut back on pork
justification: The difficulty in cutting back on pork is explicitly linked to pork being a longstanding part of the interviewee's diet.

stance_1: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
stance_2: It was difficult to cut back on pork
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that cutting back on pork was difficult.

stance_1: I have cut back on eating beef and pork
stance_2: My family eats pork and beef as staples
justification: The interviewee's reduction in beef and pork consumption contrasts with their family's continued consumption of those meats as staples.
The motivation to be healthier is directly linked to the discovery of high cholesterol.

stance_1: I want to eat only fish and seafood
stance_2: I eat more chicken and fish
justification: The interviewee's desire to eat only fish and seafood is supported by their current practice of eating more chicken and fish as a transition.

stance_1: I want to eat only fish and seafood
stance_2: My doctor recommended cutting back on red meat
justification: The doctor's recommendation to reduce red meat and favor fish/seafood motivates the interviewee's eventual goal.

stance_1: I want to eat only fish and seafood
justification: The desire to eat only fish and seafood is motivated by the interviewee's wish to be healthier.

stance_1: I want to eat only fish and seafood
justification: The discovery of high cholesterol is a motivating factor for shifting toward only fish and seafood.

stance_1: My family eats pork and beef as staples
stance_2: It was difficult to cut back on pork
justification: The family's continued consumption of pork and beef implicitly makes it more difficult for the interviewee to cut back on pork.
